qas.question: How many species is the recent day turkey suspected to have embarked from?

answers.text: descended from one of six subspecies of wild turkey

qas.question: When were turkeys first used in a domestication setting?

answers.text: Pre-Aztec tribes in south-central Mexico first domesticated the bird around 800 BC

qas.question: What other purposes have the domesticated turkey been used for aside from food?

answers.text: feathers for robes, blankets, and ceremonial purposes

qas.question: When and with what culture did domesticated turkey start to appear in the United States ?

answers.text: Pueblo Indians inhabiting the Colorado Plateau in the United States did likewise around 200 BC.

plausible_answers.text: descended from one of six subspecies

context: The modern domesticated turkey is <a0_0><b4_0>descended from one of six subspecies<b4_0/> of wild turkey<a0_0/> (Meleagris gallopavo) found in the present Mexican states of Jalisco, Guerrero and Veracruz. <a1_0><b5_0>Pre-Aztec tribes in south-central Mexico first domesticated the bird around 800 BC<b5_0/><a1_0/>, and <a3_0><b7_0>Pueblo Indians inhabiting the Colorado Plateau in the United States did likewise around 200 BC<b7_0/>.<a3_0/> They used the <a2_0><b6_0>feathers for robes, blankets, and ceremonial purposes<b6_0/><a2_0/>. More than 1,000 years later, they became an important food source. The first Europeans to encounter the bird misidentified it as a guineafowl, a bird known as a "turkey fowl" at that time because it had been introduced into Europe via Turkey.
